Five forwards, five backs: College Rugby Tens Tournament preview

Thomas Gibby looks ahead to this Saturday's annual College Rugby Tens Tournament, where reigning Emperor League champions James and Alcuin will be the favourites (Thumbnail credit Action from last year's College Tens Tournament, ultimately won by James. Photograph by George Lowther)

York seconds crush hapless Hallam

Just two days after beating their seconds team, York men's rugby seconds annihilated Sheffield Hallam thirds to go joint top of Northern Conference 3B. (Thumbnail credit Photo: Peter Iveson)

England should welcome foreign imports with open arms

Kieswetter's success shows that foreign players are a good thing for the England cricket team, Henry Cowen argues. (Thumbnail credit gingerchrismc via Flickr Creative Commons)

Outstanding women's fencers secure promotion to Premier League

York's women's fencing firsts have secured promotion to the Northern Premier League with a victory over Newcastle. (Thumbnail credit Photo: Peter Iveson)

Karting teams battle away at difficult Rye House raceday

By James Bithell

York's teams fought hard and achieved some encouraging results in the third and fourth rounds of the British University Karting Championships at the Rye House circuit in Hertfordshire (Thumbnail credit Photograph courtesy of the University of York Karting Club)

Futsal to fly the flag for York at BUCS Championships once again

York saved their best performances for the final qualifying round to book their passage to the BUCS Championships in Sheffield next weekend

College Football Round-up: March 7th

Sam Clitheroe relished playing outfield as he notched a hat-trick as James beat Langwith 4-2, while Goodricke defeated Vanbrugh 2-0 (Thumbnail credit Photograph by Justyn Hardcastle)

Alcuin turn on the style to defeat Wentworth in College Football

Alcuin produced a brand of expansive football to overcome hard-working Wentworth on Sunday morning, revitalising their title ambitions (Thumbnail credit Photograph by Justyn Hardcastle)

Late Burne header earns Derwent victory over Halifax

A late goal from centre-back Richard Burne split the sides in a tightly-contested meeting of College Football's leading side (Thumbnail credit Photograph by Justyn Hardcastle)

James Rugby overcome their stiffest test to preserve unbeaten run

By James Bithell

In beating the UYRUFC thirds 12-7 on Saturday, James College raised their game to a whole new level as tries from Rob Hanley and Huw Harrow secured the win (Thumbnail credit Photograph by Maggie Aslet)

Football seconds' title hopes take Huddersfield hit

A 3-1 home defeat to Huddersfield, their closest title challengers, all but ended the football firsts' hopes of League 5B promotion (Thumbnail credit Photograph by Justyn Hardcastle)

Many positives for Polo Club from Cambridge weekend

By James Bithell

The beginner and novice teams of the University of York Polo Club gained valuable experience in a friendly tournament with Cambridge University last week (Thumbnail credit York's beginners team: Nicola Aitken, Ottilie Wood and Munro Brett-Robertson. Courtesy UY Polo Club)

Improbable late comeback as women's rugby gain revenge on Leeds Met

Trailing 12-0 with just 15 minutes on the clock, the UYWRUFC firsts battled back against Leeds Met on Wednesday, eventually taking the game 14-12 in dramatic fashion (Thumbnail credit Photograph courtesy of UYWRUFC)

Two candidates, two different campaigns and one thrilling race

Includes this week's Nouse Sports Podcast - a debate between the two candidates

Birmingham end rugby firsts' two year 22 Acres record

For the first time in over two years the rugby firsts have lost on 'Fortress 22', with an 8-3 defeat to Birmingham in the BUCS Trophy. (Thumbnail credit Photo: Sam Newsome)

Hockey firsts beat Durham to ward off relegation fears

A penalty flick from Alec Feakes separated York and Durham yesterday afternoon, the narrow 1-0 win ensuring the hosts' place in BUCS League 2B (Thumbnail credit Photograph by Justyn Hardcastle)

Tyrrell's late goal ensures League 5B survival for hockey seconds

A 68th-minute winner by Adam Tyrrell earned the men's hockey seconds a crucial 2-1 win against Sheffield Hallam on Wednesday afternoon (Thumbnail credit Photograph by Sam Newsome)

Men's Fencing beat Newcastle to reach cup final

Despite being outnumbered two-to-one, the men's fencing team were ruthless in beating Newcastle seconds, booking their place in the BUCS Cup final later this month (Thumbnail credit Photograph by Sam Newsome)

Wednesday Round-up: March 3rd

Today's sports results from the University of York (Thumbnail credit Photograph by Sam Newsome)

James put one hand on Emperor College Rugby trophy

Sunday's comprehensive 47-12 victory over Alcuin means this term's Emperor College Rugby Championship is James's to lose (Thumbnail credit Photograph by Arran Bowen-la Grange)

One-sided it may have been, but Varsity's future is assured

York University's 91.25-19.25 Varsity victory may have been uncompetitive, but the staging of the tournament over a weekend for the first time has ensured its long-term future (Thumbnail credit Photograph by Justyn Hardcastle)

University of York win Varsity 2010

The University of York have won Varsity by a 91.25-19.25 scoreline (Thumbnail credit Photo: Peter Iveson)

Varsity Live blog

The Nouse live blog on the second day of the Varsity competition with York St. John. Football, hockey, netball, volleyball, tennis, basketball and badminton are today's events. (Thumbnail credit Photograph by George Lowther)

Varsity football and rugby cancelled

Tomorrow's Varsity football and rugby fixtures have been cancelled due to waterlogged pitches. (Thumbnail credit Photo: Peter Iveson)

Varsity 2010 - First Day Review

Following victories in today's rowing, climbing and swimming events, York University have established a useful 22.25-4.25 lead in the Varsity tournament (Thumbnail credit Photograph by Irene Sieberger)

York swimmers gain early Varsity points

York's dominance in Saturday's Varsity match-ups continued in the Archbishop Holgate pool this afternoon, as both the men's and women's swimming teams proved too strong for their local rivals. (Thumbnail credit Photo: Justyn Hardcastle)

The Nouse Sports Podcast

By James Bithell

The latest edition of our sports podcast (Thumbnail credit Photograph by Peter Iveson)

Positives for women's water polo despite Leeds defeat

York were no match for a physical Leeds team on Wednesday evening, but there were nonetheless many positives to be built upon (Thumbnail credit Action from York's match with Leeds earlier in the campaign. There were many improvements in the home performance from their last meeting. Photograph by Irene Sieberger)

Women's hockey bow out of the cup at semi-final stage

A tenth minute Sheffield winner was enough to split the teams in this tense, if uninspiring, BUCS Cup Semi-final on Wednesday afternoon (Thumbnail credit Photograph by Justyn Hardcastle)

Football firsts keep promotion hopes flickering

Goals from Jack Crane and Conor Brennan, plus a vastly improved second-half performance, were enough to overcome the challenge of Newcastle this afternoon (Thumbnail credit Photograph by Justyn Hardcastle)
